lead_paragraph: President Obama, in the final day of his historic visit, urged President Raúl Castro to loosen his grip on the economy and political expression or risk squandering the fruits of a historic thaw.

headline.print_headline: Obama, in Havana Speech, Urges Cuba to Embrace Change
headline.main: Obama, in Havana Speech, Says Cuba Has Nothing to Fear From U.S.

snippet: President Obama, in the final day of his historic visit, urged President Raúl Castro to loosen his grip on the economy and political expression or risk squandering the fruits of a historic thaw.
abstract: Pres Obama, during remarks at Grand Theater of Havana, appeals to Cuban Pres Raul Castro to allow greater political and economic freedoms, saying change would best allow country to take advantage of thawed relations with United States; stresses that Cuba has nothing to fear from America, nor its own citizens.
